Articles.Content:
I've encountered a problem which I don't know happens by design, caused by some mod or it's a bug.

I'm assembling a transfer vehicle in orbit - it's a rather big Eve lander with just enough dV to get it down and make it to orbit once again. It uses complex Asparagus staging and I don't want it to mess with tug modules that have to transfer that monster to Eve.

The problem is - I specifically right click docking ports and disable cross-feed, but once I dock another tug module to it, this setting gets undone and I have to re-disable crossfeeds of all connected docking ports again.

Is there a way to disable the fuel crossfeed so that it stays disabled?

I think it's fixed for 1.05.

Check the spoiler in announcement.

Edited October 16, 2015 by bzimac

One way round it for now is to disable the fuel and oxidiser in the individual tanks themselves. That way they will hold onto their fuel regardless of docking manoeuvres. Of course, if you have a lot of tanks, its going to be a bit of a pain to do!
